item.title: Jay-Z answers Cuba critics in 'Open Letter'
item.description: Jay-Z answers Cuba critics in 'Open Letter.'

item.title: Lawmakers question Beyonce and Jay-Z's Cuba trip
item.description: Two Republican members of Congress are wondering why the superstars were allowed to travel to Cuba.

item.title: Jennifer Aniston sports short shorts
item.description: It's nice to see Jennifer Aniston back on a red carpet. She stepped out in a summery black shorts outfit to promote 'Call Me Crazy.'

item.title: Bombing victim Krystle Campbell remembered, honored
item.description: She had worked as a manager at Jimmy's Steer House in Arlington, Mass., only a short while but 29-year-old Krystle Campbell had left an impression.

item.title: NBA player Jason Collins comes out as a gay man
item.description: Jason Collins, a 12-year NBA veteran, is the first male athlete in a major American team sport to come out as a gay.

item.title: Cloning takes California's ancient redwood trees abroad
item.description: California's mighty redwoods are going international, cloned in an effort to promote reforestation and deal with climate change.

item.title: Chaz Bono continues to slim down
item.description: In February, Dancing With the Stars alum Chaz Bono revealed he had lost more than 40 pounds. Over the weekend, he showed off an even slimmer shape at the GLAAD Awards in Los Angeles.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn and Tiger Woods have matching Masters outfits
item.description: Call her a traditionalist.

item.title: Chevy Cruze diesel: 46 highway mpg, but only 27 in town
item.description: Chevrolet says the diesel version of its Cruze compact sedan will be rated by the government at 46 miles per gallon on the highway, the best of any non-hybrid car.

item.title: 'American Idol': Oh, yes, it's ladies' night
item.description: The girls get a 'Divas' theme and pick songs from the years they were born.

item.title: Justices decline N.Y. case restricting guns in public
item.description: The Supreme Court on Monday declined to consider whether the Second Amendment protects the right to carry a gun outside the home.

item.title: Gwyneth Paltrow says she lights up once a week
item.description: The single light American Spirit is her guilty pleasure.

item.title: Photo tour: Best all-inclusive resorts in the Caribbean
item.description: Oyster.com has visited dozens of all-inclusive resorts in the Caribbean, and while it's not easy to single just one out, here's a list of our very favorites, from a secluded spot on gorgeous Turks and Caicos

item.title: Bubba Watson is no fan of viewers calling in violations
item.description: Watson had his own stories about callers accusing him of breaking a rule.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S4 is loaded with gee whiz features
item.description: With its Galaxy smartphone franchise, Samsung has emerged as Apple's chief rival in the smartphone space.

item.title: 2nd child of Pa. couple dies after only praying
item.description: Couple is already on probation for the death one son after they chose to prayer instead of a doctor.

item.title: Obama praises Calif. AG's looks
item.description: We can't help but wonder what the first lady is going to think of this. At a fundraiser Thursday in California, President Obama had nothing but praise for state Attorney General Kamala Harris -- including her

item.title: 11 reasons Jack Nicklaus is better than Tiger Woods
item.description: Things may change, but the Golden Bear beats Tiger for now.
